articles.author: Timour Azhari
articles.description: Students returned to classrooms in Syria on Sunday after the country's new rulers ordered schools reopened in a potent sign of some normalcy a week after rebels swept into the capital in the dramatic overthrow of President Bashar al-Assad.
articles.title: Syrian authorities reopen schools, a week after upheaval that overthrew Assad

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli military strikes across the Gaza Strip killed at least 28 Palestinians, including a journalist and rescue workers, medics said, and the Israeli military said troops carried out air and ground attacks in the northern Gaza Strip, killing dozens of militants while capturing others.
articles.title: Israeli troops carry out air, ground attacks in Gaza

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 11 people were killed after a cyclone slammed into Mayotte, the most intense storm to hit the French Indian Ocean archipelago north of Madagascar in nearly a century, French weather forecasters and authorities said on Sunday.
articles.title: Cyclone slams into France's Mayotte archipelago, killing at least 11

articles.author: Joyce Lee, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: The court has up to six months to decide whether to remove Yoon Suk Yeol from office or to reinstate him as president after his impeachment over an attempt to declare martial law.
articles.title: South Korea court begins review of Yoon impeachment

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The threats to Israel from Syria remain despite the moderate tone of rebel leaders who ousted President Bashar al-Assad a week ago, Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz said on Sunday, amid military moves by his country to counter such threats.
articles.title: Israel sees increased threat from Syria despite moderate tone of rebel leaders

articles.author: Maayan Lubell, Jeff Mason
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu spoke with U.S. President-elect Donald Trump about developments in Syria and a recent push to secure the release of Israeli and foreign hostages held by Hamas in Gaza, he said on Sunday.
articles.title: Trump and Netanyahu discuss Gaza hostages and Syria,  Israeli PM says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Another tanker was also in distress after sustaining damage, Russian officials said. At least one person was killed.
articles.title: Oil spills into Kerch Strait after Russian tanker breaks apart in storm

articles.author: Thomas Escritt
articles.description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz will call on Germany's parliament on Monday to declare it has no confidence in him, taking the first formal step towards securing early elections following his government's collapse.
articles.title: German Chancellor Scholz to ask parliament to clear way for new elections

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris made a rare post-election joint appearance on Sunday to thank donors who raised more than $2 billion during the unsuccessful 2024 election cycle, and to urge Democrats to keep fighting for their values.
articles.title: Harris and Biden urge Democrats to fight on in rare joint appearance

articles.author: Alasdair Pal
articles.description: Seven tourists including four Australians were hospitalised in a suspected case of alcohol poisoning at a resort in Fiji, the Australian and Fijian governments said on Monday.
articles.title: Seven tourists hospitalised in Fiji from suspected alcohol poisoning
